Until then... </13> <14 id="start15" who="Hvedrung"> Soldiers, I want Svarn's head. Put an end to this futile rebellion. </14> <15 id="start16" who="Rig"> I want that man DEAD! Liv, for now, our priority is to aid Svarn. Do not disappoint me. </15> <16 id="start17" who="Liv"> I am not worried in the least. My clan is well-versed in attacks from the sea. This island's terrain will give me an edge, and the enemy has their back to the water. </16> <17 id="harbor1" who="Liv"> My clan is master of the seas as well as trade. It is crucial that we build a harbor. </17> <18 id="fame0" who="Liv"> We now have enough fame to upgrade our mercenary raids at the forge, but I don't think it will be enough to secure a victory. We should wait until we can unleash their full potential and target the enemy's town hall. </18> <19 id="ask1" who="Svarn"> We are starving... Winter might be our last... ordeal at this rate. </19> <20 id="ask2" who="Svarn"> Please, spare some food. We shall be... grateful. </20> <21 id="ask3" who="Liv"> Hmm, winter looms ahead, indeed. A drain on my pantry will not make my job any easier. </21> <22 id="ask4" who="Liv"> Moreover, I'm fairly certain this will not be the last of their requests. </22> <23 id="ask5" who="Rig"> I understand this is quite a sacrifice, Liv, but if they starve to death, there will be no one left to rescue. </23> <24 id="ask6" who="Liv"> Fair enough. </24> <25 id="defeatBoar1" who="Svarn"> I cannot... resist their attacks any longer... All is lost... </25> <26 id="defeatBoar2" who="Rig"> I am sorry we failed you, Svarn. May you join Freyja in Fólkvang... </26> <27 id="end1" who="Liv"> Finally! Those tough devils have yielded. </27> <28 id="end2" who="Svarn"> My... deepest thanks. We have lost many a good man, but they all... knew the risks they faced in... defying Hvedrung. </28> <29 id="end3" who="Svarn"> I take no... joy in seeing his men die, though, for they too were once our brethren. </29> <30 id="end4" who="Rig"> I can only imagine how painful a civil war must be. Svarn, your brothers have not died in vain. Join me, and together we shall put an end to Hvedrung's plans. </30> <31 id="end5" who="Svarn"> We will... gladly join your cause. There is much you have to... know about Hvedrung, and there might be yet more I need to learn... </31> <32 id="requestFailA1" who="Rig"> Svarn, we tried our best, but we cannot afford to spare supplies this time. </32> <33 id="requestFailA2" who="Svarn"> I... do not doubt your good will. Thank you for trying... Worry not, for we can still resist on our own. </33> <34 id="requestFailB1" who="Rig"> Svarn... Once again, we are unable to provide supplies. Will you be able to hold on? </34> <35 id="requestFailB2" who="Svarn"> Our situation is getting... grimmer by the day. To be frank, we are hanging by a thread. </35> <36 id="requestFailB3" who="Rig"> Liv, did you hear? I do not think there will be a third time. If we let Svarn down once more, he is done for! </36> <37 id="requestFailB4" who="Liv"> Yes, I heard. I am trying my best here. </37> <38 id="requestFailB5" who="Rig"> I know, Liv, I know. </38> <39 id="firstTowerDown1" who="Svarn"> We are... losing ground... </39> <40 id="firstTowerDown2" who="Liv"> Will you be able to hold out? </40> <41 id="firstTowerDown3" who="Svarn"> I... think so... Two towers still stand. We should be able to fend them off... for how long, I do not know. </41> <42 id="secondTowerDown1" who="Svarn"> Our... second tower is down... </42> <43 id="secondTowerDown2" who="Liv"> Hmm, things are starting to look grim. </43> <44 id="secondTowerDown3" who="Rig"> What can we do, apart from matching his requests? </44> <45 id="secondTowerDown4" who="Liv"> I am not sure... Maybe we should try to distract Hvedrung's forces? </45> <46 id="secondTowerDown5" who="Rig"> You're probably right. At any rate, Svarn will not be able to hold out for long. If they lose their last tower, they are done for. </46> <47 id="fame1" who="Liv"> Now we're talking! Our mercenary raids can be fully upgraded. We will be able to harry the loyalists' shores efficiently! </47>
Rescue.tutorial: <0 id="title"> The Clan of Huginn and Muninn </0> <1 id="sentence1"> The Raven Clan can use their deep pockets filled with [Money]s to colonize new zones. They are the masters of trade and seldom lack riches. </1> <2 id="sentence2"> Their main asset is the ability to launch [Mercenary] Raids to harry their foes from the sea, while keeping out of reach from retaliation. </2>

Giants.name: ヨトゥンヘイム
Giants.desc: 我々は、アスガルドのルーンストーンへの旅の道中、巨人の地ヨトゥンヘイムを越えなければならない。 霜の巨人は平和的な民だ。きっと上手くいくだろう。
Giants.objectives: <0 id="mWar"> 敵勢力を撃破して、自分の軍勢が領域を通過できるようにせよ。 </0> <1 id="mHeroGiant"> 霜の巨人の英雄を何に代えても死なせるな。 </1> <2 id="mSword"> 霜の巨人の古代の伝承を紐解き、紛争を平和的に解決せよ。 </2> <3 id="bTrade"> 彼らが通行を許可するまで、交易を通じて[GiantFaction]の味方に[Food]を供給せよ。 </3> <4 id="bSword"> 巨大な剣の研究を通して、霜の巨人の忘れられた歴史を明らかにせよ。 </4> <5 id="bMender"> [Mender]なしで勝利せよ。 </5> <6 id="mTrade"> 彼らが通行を許可するまで、交易を通じて[GiantFaction]の味方に[Food]を供給せよ。 </6>
Giants.cinematic: <0> 内なる葛藤を感じさせぬ平穏な顔つきで、反乱した猪のクランの指導者スヴァーンは、ヴェルドルングの企みの詳細を語った。だが吾輩には、彼の心の奥底に苦悩が感じられた。 </0> <1> 暴君はアスガルドへと繋がる伝説の橋ビフロストの破壊を企てていたが、その理由は分からない。だがこれは、神々の...そして我々自身の終焉ともなる、ラグナロクをもたらすことになるだろう。スヴァーンの反乱はひとえに、これを防ぐためにあったのだ。 </1> <2> ビフロストは、ノースガードの奥地のどこかに隠されている。スヴァーンは巨大なアスガルドのルーンストーン、オーディン自身によって刻まれたと言われている壁画を解読して、その在処を暴きたいと望んでいた。 </2> <3> これは、果てなき旅への始まりに過ぎなかった。その第一歩は、巨人の棲まう地、ヨトゥンヘイムと呼ばれる領域を通り抜けることだった。 </3>
Giants.texts:
<0> さて、ここがヨトゥンヘイムだ。我々は過去に霜の巨人と交流を持ったことがある。彼らの故郷を通らせてもらうことにあまり不安は感じないな。 </0> <1> 否、フィヨルスヴィンよ。羊毛と肉の全ては我々のものであることは明らかなり。動物も彼らが食べる草も我々のものなれば、その恩恵に与るは我々であることこそ公平というもの。 </1> <2> 汝らは感謝を示すべきだ。我々は汝らのささやかなる働きに報いるのみならず、汝らと羊とを、あらゆる危機からも守り通しているのだからな！ </2> <3> 報いる！？今正に我らの民は飢えているのだぞ！貴様はただ座り、我らの「ささやかな」労力を貧っているだけではないか！ </3> <4> 我らが羊を飼い、我らが貴様らを食わせ、服を与えている。我らが生み出したるものを享受すべきは我らだ！ </4> <5> ご機嫌よう、霜の巨人たちよ。吾輩は、今は亡き高王ハルグロルフの子、リグだ。我々はヨトゥンヘイムの先に大事な用事がある。争いごとは好まない。ただ、お前の地を通らせて欲しい。 </5> <6> 黙れ、人間ども！我は汝らのことを一切知らぬ。興味もない。 </6> <7> 待て、スクリューミル、我に考えがある。正しき者は誰なのか、人間に聞いてみようではないか？ この争いはあまりにも長く続き過ぎた！ </7> <8> 吾輩はどちらにつくつもりもない。本当にただ、ここを通りたいだけだ。 </8> <9> 汝らがどちらにつくか選べば、通してやろう。 </9> <10> 私としては、羊と土地の主こそが、その恩恵を享受すべきであることは明らかだと思います。これは疑いようもなく、彼らの権利でしょう。 </10> <11> これは...甘やかされて育った...子供じみた発言ですな。所有権とは、労働者を抑圧する方法に過ぎぬが故に。 </11> <12> 私は、彼らが双方とも労働と恩恵を共有すべきと考えます。方法としては単に、仕事と納期の一覧を作り、公平に成果を分けた上で、どちら側にも... </12> <13> 単純な話じゃねえか、羊どもを全部真っ二つにして、半分ずつに分ければ良いだろ。 </13> <14> ワシは、羊の意思をも考慮すべきであると考えます。つまりは、彼らがどちらに向かうかを選ぶは、彼ら自身であるべきと。 </14> <15> 待つんだお前たち！吾輩に考えさせろ。 </15> <16> 羊毛と肉は、羊の世話と保護を懸命にこなした我らにこそ与えられるべきか？ </16> <17> ...それとも、先祖より正当に受け継がれたる羊と土地の主たる、我らか？ </17> <18> 当然、我らは分け合うことはせぬ。それこそは、我らが偉大なる先父の尽力に対する裏切りである。 </18> <19> して...汝らはどちらを選ぶ？ </19> <20> スクリューミルに一理ある。彼らは羊と土地を所有している。彼らがその恩恵を受け、労働者を守るのだ。フィヨルスヴィンとその民は、飼い主の手を噛んでいるに過ぎない！ </20> <21> フィヨルスヴィンの言う通り、たとえ所有権がなくとも、彼らは労働してきたのだから、それに見合った報酬を享受することが許されるべきだ。スクリューミルは、恩恵の一部を分けることも出来るだろう。 </21> <22> 労働とその成果を分かち合えないのと言うのは最も愚かなことであり、貴方たちの利益にはならない。ただ、私はここを通りたいだけであるから、だれも私に意見することは出来ない。 </22> <23> つまり、貴様は退廃の抑圧者どもにつくのだな！然らば、勤勉たる民の怒りの鉄槌を受けよ！ </23> <24> つまらぬ農夫に過ぎぬフィヨルスヴィンが暴力に訴えるとは、何たる驚きか。感謝を知らぬ害虫どもを追い払え。 </24> <25> 我らが裁判官たるロエーグを、潤沢なる資源とともに向かわせよう。頼りにするが良い。 </25> <26> 我らの英雄倒れたる時、我らに勝機はない。何に代えても、ロエーグを死なせてはならぬ！ </26> <27> 結局、人間はこのような恩知らずなものと同類なのだ。正統派の殿方の怒りを受ける覚悟をせよ。 </27> <28> あのクズのスクリューミルは、いつものように暴力で対抗するだろう。我々は奴を倒し、明るい未来を築かなければならぬ。 </28> <29> 人々の護衛、資源など、ヤバッドに全幅の信頼を置くがよい。 </29> <30> 我らの英雄倒れたる時、我らに勝機はない。何に代えても、ヤバッドを死なせてはならぬ！ </30> <31> これは...見よ、実に面白い。巨人の剣... この遺跡は、霜の巨人の歴史について、多くのことを教えてくれるだろう... </31> <32> たしかに。ここに入植し、学者たちに研究させるのだ。 </32> <33> さあ、古代の遺物を研究するのだ... </33> <34> 我が主よ...巨人ロエーグよ...法の執行者は戦場に倒れた！ </34> <35> ついにロエーグは降伏した！君たちに勝ち目はない。降伏しろ！人間ども！ </35> <36> 我が主よ...巨人ヤバッドよ...民衆の王者は戦場に倒れた！ </36> <37> ついにヤバッドは降伏した！君たちに勝ち目はない。降伏しろ！人間ども </37> <38> これは非常に.....興味深い..... </38> <39> ん・・・これは？ </39> <40> そうか、なるほど....これで全て合点がいき申した。これこそ...最も興奮に満ちたる発見ですぞ </40> <41> これはおそらくペルゲルミルの剣です。ただ2人生き残りし巨人のうちの一人にして、すべての霜の巨人の祖先でもあります。 </41> <42> 然り。剣こそは民を支配する力を表すのだ。我らは彼らを守り、彼らは我らのために働く。剣こそは、我々を「支配するもの」「支配されるもの」の二つに分け隔てたのだ。 </42> <43> 我らはその遺物を憎む。それこそは抑圧と分断を表している。それこそは深刻なる不正義の象徴なのだ。ペルゲルミルとは、おそらく暴君だったのだろう。 </43> <44> ふむ...双方ともに遺物から学ぼうという気がなかったのは...明らか。ペルゲルミルは彼の息子の間のいさかいをなくすため...この地に剣を置いたのだ。 </44> <45> 最初に生まれた子がペルゲルミルの遺産を継承する資格を得た。それゆえ弟は彼を憎んだ。 </45> <46> ペルゲルミルはこの地、すなわちそなたたちがヨトゥンヘイムと呼ぶこの地を二つに分け隔てた。剣は分断の象徴として意図されたものでは決してなかった。ただ、土地と痛みと...喜びを分かち合ってほしいと願っておった。彼は自らの子らに、ともに生き、ともに働いて欲しかったのだ。 </46> <47> 我は独善的に過ぎたのやもしれぬ。正直に申せば、一切働かぬことを後ろめたくは思っておったのだ。我は法を隠れ蓑としているが、実際には詐欺師のごとき感情を抱いていた。 </47> <48> そして貴様は確かに我らを守り、食わせてくれた。この世界は、ペルゲルミルの子らが元はそうしたように、労働とその成果をともに分かち合える世界なのではないか？ </48> <49> 真実を明らかにした人間よ、感謝する。この地のただ中、我らの目の前にこそ真実はあったのだな。汝らがこの地を通ることを許そう。我らはこれより戦いをやめ、ともに働くであろう。 </49> <50> あれはお前の作り話だろう？ </50> <51> ふむ、どう思われまする？これはただの巨大な石の剣...そして何も記されてはおりませぬ。ですが、このささやかなる嘘が、真実を作り出すのです。すなわち、兄弟が団結する新しき世界を。 </51> <52> なんと意地の悪い知恵か。だがまあこれで、アスガルドのルーンストーンへの旅を続けられるな。よくやってくれた、スヴァーンよ。 </52> <53> 見ろ、フィヨルスヴィンの反乱軍は粉砕された。これでお前も満足だろう。今後はお前自身が羊の世話をし、働かねばならんのだからな。 </53> <54> 我は...ぐぬぬ...そこまでは考えておらんかった。しかしまあ、それほど難しきことでもなかろう？汝らがここを通ることを許す。汝らの助力に感謝する。汝らは正しきことを行ったのだ。 </54> <55> 正しかったかは...判然とせぬ... </55> <56> そこで、スクリューミルとその領主たちは権力を奪われた。これからは一人で抵抗することになるが、今は幸せになってほしい。 </56> <57> こんなに難しいことがあるのか？ いずれにしても、怠惰な支配者に略奪されるよりはましだ。 </57> <58> まあ、元反乱軍のリーダーとして、私が見つけるのは難しいです...いや。自分を大事にして下さい。 </58> <59> 吾輩は、もっと血を流さなくても良い解決法があったのではないかと思わずにはいられない。 </59> <60> そうかも知れぬな、人間。だが、最早考えても意味はない。それでは今度こそ、さらばである。 </60> <61> そうかも知れぬな、人間。だが、最早考えても意味はない。それでは今度こそ、さらばである。 </61> <62> さらばだ、スクリューミル。 </62> <63> さらばだ、フィヨルスヴィン。 </63> <64> さて、これでアスガルドのルーンストーンへ向かう旅を続けられるな？ </64>
<73> 人間よ、これまで貴様らが我々と数多の食料を交易してきたこと、言及せずにはおれぬ。 </73> <74> 人間よ、これまで貴様らが我々と数多の食料を交易してきたこと、言及せずにはおれぬ。 </74> <75> そうだな...悪いことだったか？ </75> <76> 逆だ。むしろ、考えを改めた。貴様らが更に多くの物資をもたらすならば、我らのみでもフィヨルスヴィンの軍勢と戦えるとな。 </76> <77> 逆だ。むしろ、考えを改めた。貴様らが更に多くの物資をもたらすならば、我らのみでもスクリューミルの軍勢と戦えるとな。 </77> <78> つまり、もっと食料を渡せば、通してくれるのか？ </78> <79> 然り。貴様も後悔はすまい。我らも金が無いということは決してない故にな。 </79> <80> 然り。貴様も後悔はすまい。我らも金が無いということは決してない故にな。 </80> <81> 我々は霜の巨人とたくさんの食べ物を交換してきた...我々は約束を守る。 </81> <82> 彼らも守れることを願っています...彼らの約束を。 </82>
Giants.tutorial: <0 id="title"> グリンブルスティのクラン </0> <1 id="sentence1"> 猪のクランは自然の恵みを有効に活用できる野生の民だが、交易や建設には熟達していない。 </1> <2 id="sentence2"> また、彼らは極めて博学でもあるため、彼らが抱える術士を活用して [Lore] を素早く獲得せよ。 </2>

Trials.name: 競争
Trials.desc: この地域に足を踏み入れたのは、大陸では私たちが初めてだ。厳しく過酷な土地を自分たちで切り開いていかなければならないかもしれない。
Trials.objectives: <0 id="mFame"> ボルギルデより先に ::value:: [Fame]に到達して勝利せよ。 </0> <1 id="bWyvern"> すべての[Wyvern]を倒せ。 </1> <2 id="bGiants"> [GiantFaction]の野営地に入植せよ。 </2> <3 id="bBorgild"> 武力でボルギルデを制覇せよ。 </3>
Trials.cinematic: <0> ノースガードの奥深くへ進むに従って、吾輩の家宝である王者の角笛が本当にヘイムダルの伝説にある楽器にしてラグナロクをもたらすと言われるギャラルホルンたり得るのか、スヴァーンは疑問に思っていた。 </0> <1> 納得のいく話ではある。ヴェンドルングは吾輩の父親を殺害し、世界を終焉に導くために我が家宝を盗んだ。吾輩が奴を憎むべき理由は、いまや嫌というほどある。 </1> <2> ノースガードは既に我々がこの地に足を踏み入れたときから、数々の試練を我々にもたらした。 </2> <3> だが、次に出遭う試練は、この地に根付いたものではなかったのだ... </3>
Trials.texts: <0 id="start0A" who="Rig"> I must say, I am proud we are the first people from the mainland to venture this far into Northgard. </0> <1 id="start0B" who="DefaultBannerman"> Actually... it would seem someone beat us to it... </1> <2 id="start1" who="Borgild"> Greetings an' salutations! I'm Borgild of Bjarki, Clan of the Bear! </2> <3 id="start2" who="Rig"> Uhh... greetings? I am– </3> <4 id="start3" who="Borgild"> You are me new servants, and you can start working the fields right now. </4> <5 id="start4Stag" who="Brand"> Insolent woman! Do you not know who this man is? </5> <6 id="start4Goat" who="Halvard"> Apologies, milady, but do you realize to whom you are speaking? </6> <7 id="start4Wolf" who="Egil"> Uhh... don't you know this guy? </7> <8 id="start4Raven" who="Liv"> ...Are you aware of whom you stand before? </8> <9 id="start4Boar" who="Svarn"> Evidently... you are not... familiar with your interlocutor. </9> <10 id="start5" who="Borgild"> Oh, o' course I know him. He's Rig, son of the late High King Hargurorf. Do ye think me a peasant? </10> <11 id="start6Stag" who="Brand"> Then you are aware he is your king and that– </11> <12 id="start6Goat" who="Halvard"> Oh, good. Then you very well know he is king and– </12> <13 id="start6Wolf" who="Egil"> Okay, you're no peasant. But this guy is our king, so... </13> <14 id="start6Raven" who="Liv"> I would not dare call you this. But then, you are well aware he is king, and you are, ipso facto, his vassal. </14> <15 id="start6Boar" who="Svarn"> If you... know his lineage, you must understand... he is your king. </15> <16 id="start7" who="Borgild"> King? What king? I see no Regal Horn. No Regal Horn, no high king. We both be from the mainland, both here to conquer Northgard. For all I know, I could be heir to the throne! </16> <17 id="start8Stag" who="Brand"> You cannot be serious... </17> <18 id="start8Goat" who="Halvard"> Please do not go down this road... </18> <19 id="start8Wolf" who="Egil"> Ooh, I like her style! </19> <20 id="start8Raven" who="Liv"> As a female leader, I salute your ambition... but this is nonsense! </20> <21 id="start8Boar" who="Svarn"> This... is quite unexpected. You have... gumption, she-bear! Nevertheless, you... cannot pretend to the throne... </21> <22 id="start9Stag" who="Rig"> Brand, please. She is right, unfortunately. Without the horn, I am not officially high king. </22> <23 id="start9Goat" who="Rig"> Halvard, I share your concerns. But as a leader, I cannot shy away from this trial. </23> <24 id="start9Wolf" who="Rig"> By Hel, she has guts, I give you that. </24> <25 id="start9Raven" who="Rig"> Liv, she has a point. I am not my father–and alas, I no longer have the horn, so technically I cannot prove my birthright. </25> <26 id="start9Boar" who="Rig"> Svarn, I am afraid she may be right–I am not officially the high king. Perhaps it is my fate to prove it. </26> <27 id="start10" who="Rig"> Borgild, what would it take for you to accept me as your rightful sovereign? </27> <28 id="start11" who="Borgild"> Well... I say we engage in a contest. The clan that accomplishes the most epic deeds will be deemed victor and crowned high king. Well, high queen, most likely. </28> <29 id="start12" who="Borgild"> The loser, on the other hand... must bend the knee and satisfy the winner's every whim. </29> <30 id="start13Stag" who="Brand"> Epic deeds? When it comes to fame, you are on shaky ground with me! Lord Rig, let us put her to shame! </30> <31 id="start13Goat" who="Halvard"> That is ludicrous and unreasonable. Surely Lord Rig will not stoop to– </31> <32 id="start13Wolf" who="Egil"> Ooh, say yes! Say yes! </32> <33 id="start13Raven" who="Liv"> Fighting over fame is both childish and futile. Lord Rig will never– </33> <34 id="start13Boar" who="Svarn"> Pursuing fame is without merit... I do not... believe Lord Rig will– </34> <35 id="start14Stag" who="Rig"> Agreed. I accept the challenge, Borgild. </35> <36 id="start14Wolf" who="Rig"> What do you think? Of course I accept the challenge! </36> <37 id="start14Default" who="Rig"> I accept the challenge. </37> <38 id="start15Stag" who="Brand"> Excellent! I must admit, I was initially against this idea... but now I say make her pay for her hubris! </38> <39 id="start15GoatA" who="Halvard"> There, I knew the young lord would do the sensible thing. </39> <40 id="start15GoatB" who="Halvard"> Wait, what? Young lord, I beg you to reconsider. You've nothing to prove–you are the legitimate ruler of the clans! </40> <41 id="start15Wolf" who="Egil"> YAAAH! Fame means killing deadly things! I can't wait! </41> <42 id="start15Raven" who="Liv"> I cannot wait to waste resources just for show. Yay! </42> <43 id="start15Boar" who="Svarn"> Hmm... This is... interesting. I did not... foresee this outcome. </43> <44 id="start16Stag" who="Rig"> I am glad to hear this. Your resources and skalds will be put to good use. May this contest go down in history! </44> <45 id="start16Goat" who="Rig"> You may be right, Halvard, but I see no way around this trial. She will not let us through, and we cannot afford to antagonize her. </45> <46 id="start16Wolf" who="Rig"> Your strength and bravery will be precious assets, Egil. Let us show her how her might pales in comparison to ours! </46> <47 id="start16Raven" who="Rig"> Sarcasm noted. But my mind is made up. I will need all your wits for this. We WILL force Borgild into submission! </47> <48 id="start16Boar" who="Rig"> I understand you do not approve of my choice, but believe me, there much to be learned from this. We will emerge victorious. </48> <49 id="start17" who="Borgild"> Ha! Ye've got more nerve than I anticipated. 'Twill be interesting, for sure. Good luck to ya, hornless king! You'll be needin' it. </49> <50 id="winter1" who="Borgild"> Is it me or is it gettin' cold? Oh yes, winter is comin'! I guess you be planning on spending the cold season by the hearth, eatin' hot soup... </50> <51 id="winter2" who="Borgild"> But we won't. My clan THRIVES in winter. We won't be idlin' around, and neither should ye. </51> <52 id="winter3" who="Rig"> This will not make our task any easier. She is right–we can't afford to hibernate, or we will fall behind. </52> <53 id="wyv_unknown_small_wyvern1" who="Rig"> A wyvern! My father used to boast of fighting one during his travels, but I never really believed it was real! </53> <54 id="wyv_unknown_small_wyvern2Stag" who="Brand"> Slaying such a fiend would be worthy of a skald's song. It will not go down easily, though, so make sure you send enough warriors. </54> <55 id="wyv_unknown_small_wyvern2Goat" who="Halvard"> 'Tis the most terrifying thing I have seen in my days. And believe me, young lord, I have witnessed a great deal. Many men and women will likely die fighting this beast, if you so command it. </55> <56 id="wyv_unknown_small_wyvern2Wolf" who="Egil"> By Fenrir, I'm shaking with excitement! How hard can it be to kill? Let's find out! I've got a spot for its head above my fireplace! </56> <57 id="wyv_unknown_small_wyvern2Raven" who="Liv"> That looks... dangerous. I can see why we would risk our lives fighting it, but is it really worth it? </57> <58 id="wyv_unknown_small_wyvern2Boar" who="Svarn"> Wyverns are... mighty foes. We usually respect them and leave them be, although killing it would surely impress the she-bear. </58> <59 id="wyv_unknown_small_wyvern3" who="Rig"> It certainly won't go down without a fight. Warriors, brace yourselves! </59> <60 id="wyv_known_small_wyvern1" who="Rig"> Another wyvern! Hmm, this one looks less intimidating than what we encountered earlier. It should be easier to defeat. </60> <61 id="wyv_known_small_wyvern2Stag" who="Brand"> Indeed. We would lose fewer men and women than against the bigger one. </61> <62 id="wyv_known_small_wyvern2Goat" who="Halvard"> It still looks like a formidable opponent. We should not underestimate it. </62> <63 id="wyv_known_small_wyvern2Wolf" who="Egil"> Yeah, but it's less fun, too. The bigger bugger was more... bitey. </63> <64 id="wyv_known_small_wyvern2Raven" who="Liv"> It still looks pretty nasty. But if we REALLY must slay things to show off, it might be a better choice than the huge, nightmare-fueling one. </64> <65 id="wyv_known_small_wyvern2Boar" who="Svarn"> It is indeed less dangerous than the bigger variety... but make no mistake, it is still a very tough creature. </65> <66 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern1" who="Rig"> By Odin's missing eye! Is this a wyvern? My father boasted of fighting one, but this thing is bigger than a longship! </66> <67 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern2Stag" who="Brand"> It looks fearsome, indeed. We certainly should not expect this battle to be easily won, if winnable at all. </67> <68 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern2Goat" who="Halvard"> Attacking such a beast would be madness, young lord! I beg you not to give in to hubris. My people are tough survivors, but ordering them to face this monster would be tantamount to murder. </68> <69 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern2Wolf" who="Egil"> Whoa, I might actually be experiencing fear for the first time ever. Nah, just kidding. I'm not sure my axes can even put a dent in its scales, though. Only one way to find out! </69> <70 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern2Raven" who="Liv"> Well, this is absurd. Throwing warriors at this creature would be a needless waste of human life. On the other hand–and I can hardly believe I'm considering it–slaying it would give us a definite edge in the contest... </70> <71 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern2Boar" who="Svarn"> I have seen wyverns, but never this big. I foresee many lives being wiped out if you decide to fight it, although... it would most certainly be the stuff of legends. </71> <72 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern3Stag" who="Rig"> Agreed. At any rate, it would require more than a few warriors to bring it down. I will have to carefully consider this. </72> <73 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern3Goat" who="Rig"> You may just be right, Halvard. Yet somehow I feel we are up to the task... if we prepare carefully beforehand, that is. </73> <74 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern3Wolf" who="Rig"> I know your warriors are ready to die just for a chance to fight such a unique beast. We will probably have to send in quite a few of them, though. </74> <75 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern3Raven" who="Rig"> 'Tis quite a gamble, indeed. We stand to lose many in the fight, but should we succeed... At any rate, we shall have to plan ahead carefully. </75> <76 id="wyv_unknown_big_wyvern3Boar" who="Rig"> Many lives would be lost, 'tis true. On the other hand, if Borgild's people manage to bring it down, we might be done for. I will have to think it over. </76> <77 id="wyv_known_big_wyvern1" who="Rig"> Another wyvern! Hmm, this one is a good deal bigger than the one we saw earlier. It is bound to make more damage. </77> <78 id="wyv_known_big_wyvern2Stag" who="Brand"> It does look mightier. We should not take this beast lightly. In all likelihood, we shall have to draw even more warriors into the fight. </78> <79 id="wyv_known_big_wyvern2Goat" who="Halvard"> The "small" one looked bad enough. I dread to imagine what will happen if we disturb this one's slumber. </79> <80 id="wyv_known_big_wyvern2Wolf" who="Egil"> Yeah, it looks bigger and badder. I wonder if my axes can even make a dent in its scales. Let's find out! </80> <81 id="wyv_known_big_wyvern2Raven" who="Liv"> From a purely rational point of view, it represents even more risk, but for a similar reward. Of course, not killing it would be a missed opportunity entirely. But is it worth the extra danger? </81> <82 id="wyv_known_big_wyvern2Boar" who="Svarn"> The lesser wyverns are certainly mighty beasts, but they are nothing compared to the greater variety. </82> <83 id="giant1" who="Rig"> More Jötnar... </83> <84 id="giant2Stag" who="Brand"> Either befriending them through trade or slaying them and claiming their land would increase our fame. This is essentially an ethical dilemma, so please do as you see fit, my lord. </84> <85 id="giant2Goat" who="Halvard"> If we trade food with them, they become our allies and we gain fame. Of course, we could also slay them and claim their land, but is peace not preferable to war? </85> <86 id="giant2Wolf" who="Egil"> I say we slay 'em and take their land! That oughta show Borgild what we're made of! Sure, we could trade food with them and make them our allies... but that'd be boring. </86> <87 id="giant2Raven" who="Liv"> There are two ways we could gain fame from them: either defeat them and claim their land, or trade food with them until we've befriended them. Both are economically viable options. Decisions, decisions... </87> <88 id="giant2Boar" who="Svarn"> We can either... collaborate with them through trade or... eradicate them and claim their land. Jotnär are powerful allies, but it will be costly. On the other hand, they are mighty foes... </88> <89 id="giant3" who="Rig"> Earning their trust would take a while and cost a lot of food, but we would gain a powerful ally to accomplish other glorious deeds. Slaying them would be swifter but more dangerous and less rewarding. I need to ponder both options. </89> <90 id="end1" who="Rig"> 'Tis over, Borgild. Admit it: I beat you at your own game. </90> <91 id="end2" who="Borgild"> ... </91> <92 id="end3Stag" who="Brand"> Ha! Our victory has rendered her speechless! Do you see how futile your efforts have been, woman? </92> <93 id="end3Goat" who="Halvard"> So, milady, will you finally listen to reason and kneel before Lord Rig? </93> <94 id="end3Wolf" who="Egil"> What's wrong? That little game of yours not so fun anymore? </94> <95 id="end3Raven" who="Liv"> So, will you at last cut your losses and stop this tired nonsense? </95> <96 id="end3Boar" who="Svarn"> You have been... bested, she-bear. Do you now... see what I see in Lord Rig? </96> <97 id="end4" who="Borgild"> All right. I can't weasel out of this. Ye brought me down a peg or two, hornless king. </97> <98 id="end5" who="Rig"> That is the spirit! Do you then recognize me as your rightful king and swear allegiance to me? </98> <99 id="end6" who="Borgild"> As per the rules o' the contest, I'll submit to ya. But make no mistake: until you show me the Regal Horn, I'll NEVER accept you as my king! </99> <100 id="end7" who="Rig"> Fine by me. I am sure I will have use for your skills in the days ahead. Let us not tarry. </100> <101 id="endBelligerent1" who="Rig"> Borgild, all things considered, I have decided to put an end to this. Submit now. That is not a request. </101> <102 id="endBelligerent2" who="Borgild"> Wait, that's not how it's meant to be! Ye must respect the rules of the contest! </102> <103 id="endBelligerent3Stag" who="Brand"> It seems Lord Rig has grown impatient, though I'll concede that winning this way is not very honorable. </103> <104 id="endBelligerent3Goat" who="Halvard"> Apologies, milady, but there are more important matters at hand. Let us avoid shedding any more blood: please yield peacefully. </104> <105 id="endBelligerent3Wolf" who="Egil"> You fought well–we're just better than you. Way better, ha ha! </105> <106 id="endBelligerent3Raven" who="Liv"> Only the outcome matters. Now, surrender without making a fuss–do not give the men that satisfaction. I promise you will not regret joining us. Just swallow your pride for now. </106> <107 id="endBelligerent3Boar" who="Svarn"> I... understand your anger, but please heed our words. There is... so much more at stake than just honor. </107> <108 id="endBelligerent4" who="Borgild"> That's unfair! Rig, you despicable dog, do ye have no sense of honor? Aren't you supposed to be high king? </108> <109 id="endBelligerent5" who="Rig"> Ha ha! King? What king? I see no Regal Horn. No Regal Horn, no high king. Remember? </109> <110 id="endBelligerent6" who="Borgild"> What is your agenda? What're you after? Some kind o'... sense of achievement? </110> <111 id="endBelligerent7" who="Rig"> Maybe so. Anyway, do you agree to swear allegiance to me now? </111> <112 id="endBelligerent8" who="Borgild"> Grr... I'll never accept you as my king, but you've made your point. I concede! </112> <113 id="defeat1" who="Borgild"> Well, well, well... Looks like the mighty "high king" ain't so mighty after all. So, about this "satisfying the victor's every whim" deal... </113> <114 id="defeat2Stag" who="Brand"> My lord, I am ashamed to have failed you. She has won, and so we must surrender honorably. </114> <115 id="defeat2Goat" who="Halvard"> What did I tell you, young lord? How could you put this venture in jeopardy just for show? All is lost now... </115> <116 id="defeat2Wolf" who="Egil"> What do ya know! Looks like we have a new queen. Hey, Borg, if you need a king by your side, I'm all yours! Ow-hoooo! </116> <117 id="defeat2Raven" who="Liv"> Ah, well, it seems I have yet a new master. But I shall be glad to serve under a woman this time! Hail to the high queen! </117> <118 id="defeat2Boar" who="Svarn"> This... this cannot be happening! None will be able to stop Hvedrung now! Lord Rig, you have FAILED your people and the gods! </118> <119 id="defeat3" who="Rig"> I... I cannot believe it... </119> <120 id="defeat4" who="Rig"> Lady Borgild, I concede and pledge my allegiance to you... </120> <121 id="bearFame1Win1" who="Borgild"> You're falling behind, hornless king! You did understand the rules of the contest, right? </121> <122 id="bearFame1Win2" who="Rig"> I am just giving you a headstart, usurper! </122> <123 id="bearFame1Lose1" who="Rig"> Hey, Borgild, it looks as though you're falling behind. </123> <124 id="bearFame1Lose2" who="Borgild"> Yeah, keep talking... I'm just giving you a headstart! </124> <125 id="bearFame2Win1" who="Borgild"> Hey, mighty "high king", you're obviously no good at this, so let me give you a tip: do what I'm doing–that's how I got ahead of you. </125> <126 id="bearFame2Win2Stag" who="Brand"> Sheesh! Will this woman ever shut up? </126> <127 id="bearFame2Win2Goat" who="Halvard"> Slow and steady wins the race, milady. </127> <128 id="bearFame2Win2Wolf" who="Egil"> This chick's as cocky as she is ruthless. I think I'm in love. </128> <129 id="bearFame2Win2RavenA" who="Liv"> Trash talking is vulgar and pointless. </129> <130 id="bearFame2Win2RavenB" who="Liv"> Scumbag. </130> <131 id="bearFame2Win2Boar" who="Svarn"> Fame... is like a flower. Yours is... blooming today, but it shall be wilting tomorrow... </131> <132 id="bearFame2Win3" who="Rig"> Let us not be distracted by her taunts. Though I must admit she is irksome. </132> <133 id="bearFame2Lose1" who="Rig"> Usurper, you're evidently not so skilled at this, so here is a friendly tip: just do what I am doing–that is how I got ahead of you. </133> <134 id="bearFame2Lose2Stag" who="Brand"> Well said, my lord! </134> <135 id="bearFame2Lose2Goat" who="Halvard"> I suppose a bit of taunting cannot hurt. </135> <136 id="bearFame2Lose2Wolf" who="Egil"> Booyah! Hear that, Borg? Or are you too far behind? </136> <137 id="bearFame2Lose2Raven" who="Liv"> Tee hee. </137> <138 id="bearFame2Lose2Boar" who="Svarn"> Oh... that was actually... quite humorous. Ho ho ho. </138> <139 id="bearFame2Lose3" who="Borgild"> Och, how old are ya? </139> <140 id="bearFame3Win1" who="Borgild"> Well, it looks like I'm going to win. If you're all right with it, I'll take some time to make a list of errands for you once you're my thrall. </140> <141 id="bearFame3Win2" who="Rig"> Do not get ahead of yourself, usurper! 'Tis not over till it's over! </141> <142 id="bearFame3Lose1" who="Rig"> So, usurper, do you recognize me as your high king? </142> <143 id="bearFame3Lose2" who="Borgild"> Why should I? Last I checked, you hadn't proven your worth. </143> <144 id="bearFame3Lose3" who="Rig"> I was merely warming up. Obviously I will win at this rate. </144> <145 id="bearFame3Lose4" who="Borgild"> Grr... </145> <146 id="endDrawingNear" who="Rig"> Looks like the contest is coming to a close... </146> <147 id="borgCalmsKaija1" who="Borgild"> It's fine, Kaija... </147> <148 id="borgCalmsKaija2" who="Borgild"> That's a good girl! </148>
Trials.tutorial: <0 id="title"> The Contest </0> <1 id="sentence1"> To prove your worth to Borgild and make her recognize you as high king, you must raise your [Fame]. Do so faster than she does. </1> <2 id="sentence2"> Many feats will bring you fame: claiming camps, slaying colossal creatures, and of course developing your clan. </2>

Guardian.name: 予震
Guardian.desc: ついにアスガルドのルーンストーンへ手が届く。荒涼とした霜に覆われた草原にそれはある。あとはそこまで歩くだけだ！
Guardian.objectives: <0 id="mRunestone"> アスガルドのルーンストーンに到達し、ルーンを解読せよ。 </0> <1 id="mForge"> [Forge]を建設せよ。 </1> <2 id="mRimeSteel"> [RimeSteel]を採掘せよ。 </2> <3 id="mWurmslayer"> ドラゴンスレイヤーを鍛錬せよ。 </3> <4 id="mKillHrimgandr"> ドラゴンスレイヤーでフリムガンダルを斬り伏せよ。 </4> <5 id="bTime"> ::value:: 年目までにフリムガンダルを斬り伏せよ。 </5> <6 id="bUnits"> 一度に ::value:: 種類の異なる軍事ユニットを所有せよ。 </6> <7 id="bMine"> 一度に ::value:: 箇所の白霜鋼鉱床を稼働させよ。 </7>
Guardian.cinematic: <0> ルーンストーンへの道中、吾輩は何とかボルギルデと彼女が率いる熊のクランを従えることが出来た。彼女たちは我々と同じく、古き大陸からやってきた。だが、全く異なる海岸に着いたのだろう。 </0> <1> ルーンストーンに近づくにつれ、スヴァーンの動揺が更に増していく。待ち受ける「何か」に怯えていると打ち明けてはくれたが、それが何なのかは彼にも分からなかった。 </1> <2> 吾輩に付き従う者の幾人かも、前に進みたがらなかった。ノースガードの地は更に過酷さを極めている。まるで、我々の目的を邪魔しようとするかのように... </2>
Guardian.texts: <0 id="start1" who="Rig"> Hmm, the air is g-getting colder. Much c-colder, as a matter of f-fact. </0> <1 id="start2" who="Brand"> That is one w-way to put it... I am f-f-freezing! </1> <2 id="start3" who="Egil"> Yeah, I'm kind of regretting all my l-life choices, being a b-b-berserker and all. I c-can't feel my t-toes... </2> <3 id="start4" who="Halvard"> I j-just long for a hot s-soup b-by the hearth... </3> <4 id="start5" who="Liv"> I am thinking of all the f-firewood we'll have to b-burn to get warm again, and it is making me d-depressed... </4> <5 id="start6" who="Borgild"> Come, now! A little cold air never killed no one! Are ye all babies? Want me to tuck ye in warm little beddies? </5> <6 id="start7" who="Egil"> Hey, I'm all f-for you warming up my b-bed... </6> <7 id="start8" who="Liv"> Really, Egil... </7> <8 id="start9" who="Borgild"> Let's just say ye're not me type, doggy boy... </8> <9 id="start10" who="Rig"> Lo! We have arrived... the R-Runestone of A-Asgard lies yonder! Let us hie there! </9> <10 id="start11" who="Rig"> S-Svarn? </10> <11 id="start12" who="Svarn"> We should... turn back. I... do not wish... to FACE what lies ahead! </11> <12 id="start13" who="Borgild"> Come on, piggy, it's just a big stone. Ye boars aren't afraid of rocks now, are ye? </12> <13 id="start14" who="Rig"> Whoa! What was that? </13> <14 id="start15" who="Svarn"> NO! NOT... THIS! THIS BEAST HAS... HAUNTED MY DREAMS ALL MY LIFE! </14> <15 id="start16" who="Borgild"> Ooooh! 'Tis a Hrímgandr! I never saw one with me own two eyes. All me ancestors famously killed one each! </15> <16 id="start17" who="Rig"> You th-think you c-can s-slay that b-beast, B-Borgild? </16> <17 id="start18" who="Borgild"> Well, I can't pass up the chance to hang its head in my trophy room. Even if I die tryin'. Let's settle here. </17> <18 id="start19" who="Rig"> Ahh, 'tis good to feel my fingers again. So, how should we go about slaying the beast? </18> <19 id="start20" who="Borgild"> Those beasties are pretty much invulnerable to basic weapons. We have to forge a special family weapon we call the Wurmslayer. We'll need some rimesteel and a forge. </19> <20 id="start21" who="Rig"> RIMESTEEL? The famous icy ore said to be found only in Niflheim?! </20> <21 id="start22" who="Borgild"> Ye southerners sure know how to inflate yer legends. No need to go to Niflheim: Hrímgandar typically live in rimesteel-rich environments, so we shouldn't have too much trouble finding some 'round here. </21> <22 id="start23" who="Rig"> Weeeelll... good luck with that. </22> <23 id="start24" who="Brand"> Borgild, I will help you fend off the beast while the miners are at work. Even if we cannot make a dent in its armor for the time being, we should be able to distract it, no? </23> <24 id="start25" who="Halvard"> Clearly I cannot watch this from the sidelines... I shall help too, Lady Borgild! </24> <25 id="start26" who="Egil"> Can't let a chick take all the credit for downing such a big monster now, can I? Count me in, Borg! </25> <26 id="start27" who="Liv"> Not too keen on being devoured alive, but... we haven't much of a choice, it would appear. Count me in, too! </26> <27 id="start28" who="Svarn"> I need to face my DEEPEST fears... I shall fight with you all! </27> <28 id="start29" who="Borgild"> All right, let's do this! </28> <29 id="enoughIronNoForge1" who="Rig"> We have enough rimesteel to start forging the Wurmslayer! </29> <30 id="enoughIronNoForge2" who="Borgild"> So... what are ye waitin' for? Build a forge already! </30> <31 id="wurmSlayerPart1" who="Rig"> The Wurmslayer's blade has been forged! </31> <32 id="wurmSlayerPart2" who="Rig"> The Wurmslayer's crossguard has been forged! </32> <33 id="wurmSlayerPart3" who="Rig"> The Wurmslayer is complete! </33> <34 id="killHrimgandr1" who="Borgild"> Och! 'Twas about time! Now I get to live up to my family's tradition of slaying Hrímgandar! </34> <35 id="killHrimgandr2" who="Egil"> Oh, boy, I can't wait! </35> <36 id="killHrimgandr3" who="Brand"> This ought to make us famous, for sure. </36> <37 id="killHrimgandr4" who="Halvard"> I cannot lie, I am indeed a tad excited. But mostly terrified. </37> <38 id="killHrimgandr5" who="Liv"> Exciting, indeed. I cannot wait to be chewed alive. </38> <39 id="killHrimgandr6" who="Svarn"> YAAAAAAAAH! </39> <40 id="winterStage1" who="Borgild"> Ooh, is it me or is this winter cooler than the last one? </40> <41 id="winterStage2" who="Borgild"> Hmm, winters are getting colder and colder... I don't mind, but maybe we should hurry just a little. Hrímgandar love cold winters even more than I do. </41> <42 id="winterStage3" who="Borgild"> Okay, it's getting seriously cold now, even for me. If it keeps getting worse, the Hrímgandr will become invincible for good. </42> <43 id="winterStage4" who="Borgild"> Th-this is b-bad... Even I am f-freezing... At th-this r-rate, n-next w-winter will b-be our last... </43> <44 id="defeatWinter1" who="Borgild"> 'T-tis m-mighty c-cold... Th-there's no w-way w-we can k-kill the b-beastie now... </44> <45 id="defeatWinter2" who="Rig"> D-darn, we have to b-back down... </45> <46 id="defeatWinter3" who="Svarn"> Th-then it m-means th-that nothing will stand in Hvedrung's w-way now... All is l-lost... </46> <47 id="end1" who="Svarn"> I feel... relieved... </47> <48 id="end2" who="Borgild"> See, piggy? The beastie's dead. I think I'll need a bigger fireplace, though. 'Tis a big one. </48> <49 id="end3" who="Halvard"> Strange... The air suddenly became slightly warmer... </49> <50 id="end4" who="Borgild"> Me ancestors used to say killing a Hrímgandr could hasten spring. Maybe that's why winters were getting harsher in the area? </50> <51 id="end5" who="Rig"> Svarn, the only thing left to do is decipher the Runestone of Asgard... </51> <52 id="end6" who="Svarn"> Yes... Let us... see what TRUTH the runes have to tell us... </52> <53 id="firstBannerDefeatedStag" who="Brand"> Companions, I must withdraw for now. I shall return once I am back on my feet. Stay brave! </53> <54 id="firstBannerDefeatedGoat" who="Halvard"> I am not as hale as I once was... I must catch my breath and get these wounds taken care of... But I will return once I have recovered! </54> <55 id="firstBannerDefeatedWolf" who="Egil"> Darn, that thing packs quite a punch... Hate to say it, but I need to back down for now. I'll come back soon as I get these wounds patched up! </55> <56 id="firstBannerDefeatedRaven" who="Liv"> Ouch! Sorry, all, I have to back down for now... I will come back once my wounds have healed. Stay strong! </56> <57 id="firstBannerDefeatedBoar" who="Svarn"> I am... heavily wounded. Sorry, companions, but I must... withdraw for now. I shall return as soon as I have... healed. </57> <58 id="hrimgandrFeedsOffRimesteel1" who="Rig"> What the...?! The Hrímgandr just devoured a rimesteel deposit! </58> <59 id="hrimgandrFeedsOffRimesteel2" who="Borgild"> Aye, Hrímgandar feed on rimesteel. That's why they live close to deposits. </59> <60 id="hrimgandrFeedsOffRimesteel3" who="Rig"> I suppose we shouldn't let it get too comfortable, then. It has probably been idle for too long. If we let it eat all the rimesteel, we'll be left with no way to slay it. </60> <61 id="defeatNoRimesteel1" who="Borgild"> My prospectors just reported there wasn't enough rimesteel left in those plains to forge a Wurmslayer... It's hopeless. </61> <62 id="defeatNoRimesteel2" who="Rig"> Hmm, there has to be a way... Could we wait for it to die of old age? </62> <63 id="defeatNoRimesteel3" who="Borgild"> Hah... Do ye have a thousand years to spare? It's hopeless, I tell ya! </63> <64 id="firstRimesteelColonized" who="Borgild"> Good, 'tis the first territory with rimesteel we control... We'd best defend it, 'cause the beastie don't like trespassers! </64>
Guardian.tutorial: <0 id="title"> The Clan of Bjarki </0> <1 id="sentence1"> This clan is less susceptible to the effects of winter and cold than others, and is even more powerful and productive during that season! </1> <2 id="sentence2"> Their mastery of shields and ability to train armored bears make them experts in the art of defense. </2>

Act2Ending.name: The Runestone of Asgard
Act2Ending.cinematic: <0> We had finally reached the Runestone of Asgard. Whoever Hvedrung was, his actions seemed to be foretold by the old scriptures etched in the stone. </0> <1> Svarn translated: "He will want to set the men free from the yoke of the All-Father, for he does not want them to share in his feast, and to this end he will destroy Bifrost." </1> <2> "As the wail of Gjallarhorn echoes through the skies, the sons of Muspell will march on Asgard. Thus the gods shall meet their fate, and the age of men shall begin," Svarn concluded thoughtfully. </2> <3> There was no map to Bifrost on the Runestone, but one stanza read that it was "beyond Bergelmir's Throat." This was a kenning (a metaphor) for the icy cliffs far to the north. </3>

Frozen.name: フィンブルの冬
Frozen.desc: 我々はビフロストへ至る狭き道、ベルゲルミルの喉元へと達した。ここでは、冬は無限に続くかに見える。
Frozen.objectives: <0 id="mWinter"> フィンブルの冬の終焉を待て（::value:: 年）。 </0> <1 id="mArmy"> 不死の凍てつく軍勢を生き延びよ。 </1> <2 id="bTower"> 少なくとも ::value:: 本、アップグレードされた[WatchTower]を建設せよ。 </2> <3 id="bNoTower"> [WatchTower]を建設することなく生き延びよ。 </3> <4 id="bAlly"> 仲間を誰一人として失うな。 </4>
Frozen.cinematic: <0> ベルゲルミルの喉元に近づくに従って、我々は永遠の冬に出迎えられた。ボルギルデによれば、フィンブルの冬と言うそうだ。そしてそれこそが、我々にとって最強の敵の一つとして立ちはだかった。 </0> <1> だが、ノルンの不運が重なったか、凍てつく霧の中には、寒さや飢えなどよりも危険な何かが蠢いていた... </1>
Frozen.texts: <0 id="start1" who="Rig"> You said it was getting warmer, Halvard? </0> <1 id="start2" who="Halvard"> I stand corrected. </1> <2 id="start3" who="Brand"> Good thing we have better clothes now! </2> <3 id="start4" who="Egil"> S-speak f-for yours-self, g-golden b-boy... </3> <4 id="start5" who="Borgild"> This be Fimbulvinter. </4> <5 id="start6" who="Liv"> Fimbul-what now? </5> <6 id="start7" who="Borgild"> The eternal winter, luv. </6> <7 id="start7original2" who="Borgild"> On the bright side, those undead freaks will stay frozen forever. </7> <8 id="start7original3" who="Borgild"> The downside is, we'll never get past this here wall of ice. </8> <9 id="start7alt" who="Borgild"> Which means we are never going to get past this here wall of ice... </9> <10 id="start8" who="Rig"> So, what now...? Is this the end of the road? </10> <11 id="start9" who="Svarn"> No... "Eternal" is a... poetic license, not to be taken literally. Fimbulvinter is an extremely HARSH and long winter that is supposed to last several years. </11> <12 id="start10" who="Svarn"> The legends say it is a... harbinger of Ragnarök. If they are to be believed, Hvedrung might be... close to achieving his goal. </12> <13 id="start11" who="Rig"> Then we "only" have to wait for the return of spring? </13> <14 id="start12" who="Halvard"> What concerns me slightly is what will happen when the wretched creatures thaw out... </14> <15 id="start12alt1" who="Halvard"> Then we may not look forward to spring, after all... Lo! </15> <16 id="start12alt2" who="Halvard"> The blizzard has lifted... What are those wretched figures? </16> <17 id="start13" who="Brand"> Hmm, good point. </17> <18 id="start13alt" who="Brand"> A frightful sight, indeed... Luckily, they are frozen solid. But you are right, Halvard: if the wall is bound to thaw, so are they! </18> <19 id="start14" who="Halvard"> What a peculiar feeling. We usually dread the coming of winter, not its end! </19> <20 id="start15" who="Rig"> Bergelmir's Throat is a funnel-shaped gorge, and we are on its broad end. I suggest we spread out our settlements to weaken the impact of the attack. </20> <21 id="start16" who="Liv"> A reasonable solution. That way, no one will bear the full brunt of the assault. </21> <22 id="playerCenterAllyIntroStag" who="Rig"> Brand and I will be defending the middle. </22> <23 id="playerCenterAllyIntroGoat" who="Rig"> Halvard and I will be defending the middle. </23> <24 id="playerCenterAllyIntroWolf" who="Rig"> Egil and I will be defending the middle. </24> <25 id="playerCenterAllyIntroRaven" who="Rig"> Liv and I will be defending the middle. </25> <26 id="playerCenterAllyIntroBoar" who="Rig"> Svarn and I will be defending the middle. </26> <27 id="playerCenterAllyIntroBear" who="Rig"> Borgild and I will be defending the middle. </27> <28 id="playerRightAllyIntroStag" who="Rig"> Brand will protect our right flank... </28> <29 id="playerRightAllyIntroGoat" who="Rig"> Halvard will protect our right flank... </29> <30 id="playerRightAllyIntroWolf" who="Rig"> Egil will protect our right flank... </30> <31 id="playerRightAllyIntroRaven" who="Rig"> Liv will protect our right flank... </31> <32 id="playerRightAllyIntroBoar" who="Rig"> Svarn will protect our right flank... </32> <33 id="playerRightAllyIntroBear" who="Rig"> Borgild will protect our right flank... </33> <34 id="playerLeftAllyIntroStag" who="Rig"> ... and Brand the left one. </34> <35 id="playerLeftAllyIntroGoat" who="Rig"> ... and Halvard the left one. </35> <36 id="playerLeftAllyIntroWolf" who="Rig"> ... and Egil the left one. </36> <37 id="playerLeftAllyIntroRaven" who="Rig"> ... and Liv the left one. </37> <38 id="playerLeftAllyIntroBoar" who="Rig"> ... and Svarn the left one. </38> <39 id="playerLeftAllyIntroBear" who="Rig"> ... and Borgild the left one. </39> <40 id="allyAgreesStag" who="Brand"> Very well, my lord. </40> <41 id="allyAgreesGoat" who="Halvard"> As you command. </41> <42 id="allyAgreesWolf" who="Egil"> G-got it! </42> <43 id="allyAgreesRaven" who="Liv"> Understood. </43> <44 id="allyAgreesBoar" who="Svarn"> So be it. </44> <45 id="allyAgreesBear" who="Borgild"> Aye! </45> <46 id="start17" who="Rig"> Then it is settled. Let us gather as many resources as we can and prepare to resist the charge when Fimbulvinter ends. </46> <47 id="winterHurryEndOfYear1" who="Rig"> The first year has flown by. We have three more years before the end of Fimbulvinter. The air is already warming. </47> <48 id="winterHurryEndOfYear2" who="Rig"> Only two years left before the thaw. Now is no time to rest! </48> <49 id="winterHurryLastYear" who="Rig"> Another year has passed... Fimbulvinter should end next year, if the legends are true. We ought to work twice as hard! </49> <50 id="winterEnds" who="Rig"> Fimbulvinter is over! </50> <51 id="armyAttack1Stag" who="Brand"> My lord, the remainder of the army is thawing out! </51> <52 id="armyAttack1Goat" who="Halvard"> By Odin's eye... The frozen army is bound to descend on us! </52> <53 id="armyAttack1Wolf" who="Egil"> Ah... It's warmin' up finally... Freaks incoming! Get ready to fight! </53> <54 id="armyAttack1Raven" who="Liv"> The army of the dead is thawing out... </54> <55 id="armyAttack1Boar" who="Svarn"> The dead are... inbound... </55> <56 id="armyAttack1Bear" who="Borgild"> 'Tis warmer, all right! The freaks be incoming! </56> <57 id="armyAttack2" who="Rig"> Brace yourselves for battle! This is the final assault... We will hold our ground... or die trying! </57> <58 id="rightAllyFallsStag" who="Brand"> My lord, the eastern front has fallen! We must prepare for an attack on our right flank! </58> <59 id="rightAllyFallsGoat" who="Halvard"> Young lord, I fear our friends on the eastern front have fallen! We should brace for an attack from the right! </59> <60 id="rightAllyFallsWolf" who="Egil"> Those guys on the right side didn't make it. Just means more monsters for me to fight! Sweet! </60> <61 id="rightAllyFallsRaven" who="Liv"> Blast, the eastern front has failed to hold their position. Our right side is now exposed. </61> <62 id="rightAllyFallsBoar" who="Svarn"> Our friends on the... eastern front have fallen. We MUST be prepared to deal with their attackers. </62> <63 id="rightAllyFallsBear" who="Borgild"> Och, those weaklings on the eastern side didn't make it! Prepare to be attacked from the right! </63> <64 id="leftAllyFallsStag" who="Brand"> My lord, the western front has fallen! Our left flank is bound to be harried soon! </64> <65 id="leftAllyFallsGoat" who="Halvard"> Young lord, our friends on the western front did all they could, but they have been overwhelmed. We are bound to be attacked from the left! </65> <66 id="leftAllyFallsWolf" who="Egil"> And there goes the left side! I get their share of the freaks to battle! Nice! </66> <67 id="leftAllyFallsRaven" who="Liv"> Bad news... The western front is no more. Our left side is now vulnerable. </67> <68 id="leftAllyFallsBoar" who="Svarn"> Our allies on the... western front are no more. We must BRACE for an attack from the left. </68> <69 id="leftAllyFallsBear" who="Borgild"> Ye got to be kidding me. The men to the west had ONE job! If they've failed, we'll be attacked from the left soon. </69> <70 id="end1" who="Rig"> Phew, that was not an easy battle. Salvage whatever is left and heal the wounded. </70> <71 id="end2" who="Brand"> Lo! The wall of ice is melting! </71> <72 id="end3" who="Egil"> It's about time! Let's get out of here before I cool down. </72> <73 id="end4" who="Liv"> At last! I just hope what lies beyond is not even colder. </73> <74 id="end5" who="Borgild"> Even I am fed up with all that snow. Think I've got rime in me boots. </74> <75 id="end6" who="Halvard"> I fear the worst is yet to come. </75> <76 id="end7" who="Svarn"> Indeed... Beyond Bergelmir's Throat is Bifröst... and Hvedrung. We must STOP this madman. </76> <77 id="end8" who="Rig"> We must carry on. Whatever is next will be the end of our quest. We are nearing the northern borders of Northgard. </77> <78 id="end10" who="Rig"> Let us march on! TO BIFROST! </78> <79 id="end9" who="Rig"> I can only promise you more blood and tears. But our fate, and that of Northgard–perhaps all of humanity–will soon be sealed. </79>
Frozen.tutorial: <0 id="title"> フィンブルの冬 </0> <1 id="sentence1"> 大厳冬は数年間続く。春の到来と同時に大氷壁が溶け出すのを待て。 </1> <2 id="sentence2"> 不死の軍勢が融け出す。その襲撃に備えよ。力を合わせて打ち勝つためにも、自らの味方を守り抜け！ </2>

Bifrost.name: ビフロスト
Bifrost.desc: ビフロスト、アスガルドに繋がる伝説の橋がこの地に座す。ヴェンドルングは既にここに至っている。そして我々はラグナロクの瀬戸際にいるのだ。何に代えても我々は彼を止めなければならない！
Bifrost.objectives: <0> 何に代えても [Bifrost] を守れ！。 </0> <1> ヴェンドルングを倒せ。 </1> <2> 每年 [Muspell] を1つ封印せよ。 </2> <3> 哀れな [KoboldFaction] をすべて倒せ。 </3> <4> [Bifrost]の耐久度を 50% より下に落とすな。 </4>
Bifrost.cinematic: <0> ついに、我々は悲願に近づいていた。悠久の長きにわたってビフロストが眠ってきた地は...平和であった。天上の如き、ですらあった。 </0> <1> だが我々が先に進むにしたがって、形容し難い大きな音が天と地とを揺るがした。それは未だに吾輩の中でこだましている。 </1> <2> これはギャラルホルンの嘆きに他ならず、ラグナロクの始まりを告げる音でもあった。 </2> <3> ヴェンドルングは我々の先を行き、ムスペルの子らをノースガードに解き放つ準備を進めている。 </3> <4> もし我々がこの伝説の橋を壊さんとする暴君の阻止に失敗すれば、この地に至るまでに積み重ねられてきたあらゆる犠牲が、水泡に帰してしまうのだろう。 </4>
Bifrost.texts: <0 id="start0" who="Rig"> Bifröst, at last! </0> <1 id="start1" who="Rig"> What a dreadful sound! </1> <2 id="start2" who="Svarn"> Hvedrung has blown Gjallarhorn... Thus, we are on the brink of Ragnarök. The sons of Muspell shall be here soon. </2> <3 id="start3" who="Rig"> Hvedrung, stop this folly at once! </3> <4 id="start4" who="Hvedrung"> I salute your determination, young king. But you are too late: with Gjallarhorn, I will open the gates of Muspelheim. </4> <5 id="start5" who="Hvedrung"> This world shall soon be engulfed in flames... but believe me, 'tis no folly. </5> <6 id="start6" who="Rig"> But why...? What have you to gain from all this? And how did the Runestone of Asgard foretell your baleful deeds? Who ARE you? </6> <7 id="start7" who="Hvedrung"> Who I am is unimportant, as were your father and your pathetic quest for revenge. All that matters is what will be gained from destroying Bifröst. </7> <8 id="start8" who="Rig"> You are a madman! What do you want? To slay the gods? To become the absolute ruler of Asgard? </8> <9 id="start9" who="Hvedrung"> I do not seek to rule over gods or men. I wish to set Midgard and Asgard asunder, to set men free from Odin's will. </9> <10 id="start10" who="Rig"> That is nonsense! What would humans have to gain from losing the All-Father? What good would a world of ashes be to us? </10> <11 id="start11" who="Hvedrung"> Odin lives in perpetual dread of Ragnarök, for he knows he shall meet his fate. He has been training our brethren in Valhöll in hopes of preventing his inevitable demise. </11> <12 id="start12" who="Hvedrung"> He has no love for humans. To him they are mere puppets, whom he has been stringing along with empty promises of eternal glory since the dawn of time. </12> <13 id="start13" who="Svarn"> Do not listen to him, my lord... Hvedrung is a heretic. His words have poisoned many of my brothers' souls... </13> <14 id="start14" who="Svarn"> There is no... reasoning with him. The very existence of my... rebellion proves he will only respond to... force. </14> <15 id="start15" who="Hvedrung"> You are wiser than I am, Svarn. You always have been. But your faith is misguided. Fight the inevitable if you so desire. </15> <16 id="start16" who="Hvedrung"> Now, let Ragnarök... COMMENCE! </16> <17 id="start17" who="DefaultBannerman"> Fire giants incoming! </17> <18 id="start18Goat" who="Halvard"> Young lord, the final battle is nigh! You can count on us and the settlements we built all over Northgard to send you support! </18> <19 id="start18Stag" who="Brand"> My lord, the final battle is nigh! You can count on us and the settlements we built all over Northgard to send you support! </19> <20 id="muspellGate1" who="Rig"> Bifröst is under attack too! We must send troops to defend it! </20> <21 id="muspellGate2" who="DefaultBannerman"> Huh? The fire giants died suddenly! What is happening? </21> <22 id="muspellGate3" who="Rig"> It seems the Eldthursar are unable to sustain their presence far from the flames of Muspelheim. This will work in our favor, but we cannot leave Bifröst unattended. </22> <23 id="muspellGate4" who="Rig"> We must hie to any gate we can find, and then seal them! </23> <24 id="vedrfolnir1" who="DefaultBannerman"> Is that... Vedrfolnir? </24> <25 id="vedrfolnir2" who="Rig"> Its senses must have been disrupted by Gjallarhorn. The poor thing has crashed to the ground. </25> <26 id="start22old" who="Rig"> I know I am asking much of you all. Everything we have done–every life taken, every life lost–has led us to this point. </26> <27 id="start23old" who="Rig"> We must protect Bifröst at all costs! We cannot allow Ragnarök to happen! Hvedrung dies this day! </27> <28 id="helpReceivedStag" who="Brand"> My lord, we have just received a shipment of supplies and reinforcements from our Northgard allies. </28> <29 id="helpReceivedGoat" who="Halvard"> Young lord, we have received help and supplies from our Northgardian fellows! </29> <30 id="helpReceivedWolf" who="Egil"> Hey, Rig, we just got more guys and supplies from all over Northgard! </30> <31 id="helpReceivedRaven" who="Liv"> I've been informed that our settlements all across Northgard have sent help and supplies. </31> <32 id="helpReceivedBoar" who="Svarn"> Our Northgardian... brethren have sent us men and a shipment of supplies! </32> <33 id="helpReceivedBear" who="Borgild"> Hey, hornless king, we just received blokes and a bunch of supplies from the rest of Northgard! </33> <34 id="end1" who="Rig"> At long last! I have finally cornered you. </34> <35 id="end2" who="Hvedrung"> ... </35> <36 id="end3" who="Svarn"> Hvedrung, you have... lost. Ragnarök has not... come to pass. Everything you did was in vain. </36> <37 id="end4" who="Egil"> He's yours! Kill this rascal! </37> <38 id="end5" who="Borgild"> Look, the coward surrenders! Kill him anyway! </38> <39 id="end6" who="Brand"> What do you have to say for yourself, fiend? </39> <40 id="end7" who="Hvedrung"> ... </40> <41 id="end8" who="Halvard"> So much suffering... and for what? </41> <42 id="end9" who="Liv"> Well, clearly he has nothing to say in his own defense. </42> <43 id="end10" who="Brand"> Your revenge is at hand, my lord. </43> <44 id="end11" who="Rig"> You must be truly mad. Faced with your own demise, you dare laugh at my face? I will put you out of your misery. </44> <45 id="end12" who="Hvedrung"> You are victorious, high king... </45> <46 id="end13" who="Hvedrung"> ... But you still arrived too late. </46> <47 id="defeat1" who="Hvedrung"> Finally... the sons of Muspell have destroyed Bifröst... </47> <48 id="defeat2" who="Hvedrung"> Odin, prepare to meet your fate! </48> <49 id="Horn1" who="Hvedrung"> [Vuvuzela] </49> <50 id="allGatesSealed1" who="Rig"> There, all the gates have been sealed. We can call back the other bannermen, as we no longer need them as backup. </50> <51 id="allGatesSealed2" who="DefaultBannerman"> Understood. </51>
Bifrost.tutorial: <0 id="title"> ムスペルの子 </0> <1 id="sentence1"> 炎の巨人がムスペルヘイムの門から溢れ出る。彼らの流入を減らすため、巨人たちを跳ね返しつつ、できるだけ多くの門を封印せよ。 </1> <2 id="sentence2"> 何に代えてもビフロストを守り抜き、ヴェンドルングの部下による襲撃を生き延び、彼の愚行に終止符を打て！ </2>

GameEnding.name: ラグナロク
GameEnding.cinematic: <0> ヴェンドルングはついに吾輩の手に落ちた。彼は敗北し、我々は勝利した。あるいはそう思っていた。 </0> <1> 哀れなる彼の生を終わらせようとした時、ヴェンドルングは穏やかに笑う。後悔も苦さの欠片も見せぬように。 </1> <2> 「貴公は勝利を収めた、高王よ」と彼は言った。「だがそれでも、貴公は遅すぎた。ビフロストはまだその姿を保っている。だが、世界樹はその根本から揺るがされた。貴公はラグナロクを防いだと思っているだろう。だが言わせて貰おう。我らは今、そのただ中に居ると」 </2> <3> 彼は続けた。「私が為すべきは成就を見た。人間たちはオーディンの支配から開放されていないかもしれぬ。だが彼らは反逆も選択肢となりうることを知った。これは新たなる時代の夜明けである。さあ、好きにせよ。我が命を断つも、救うも。最早何も変わらぬ」 </3> <4> 何故彼の言葉が吾輩の心を穿ったのか、それは分からない。吾輩は突然彼の命を奪う気を失くした。それが如何に無益であるかを悟ったのだ。彼を仕留めても父親は戻らない。それに、彼は正しかった。ラグナロクはまだ終わっていなかったのだ。 </4> <5> もしくは...始まった、と言うべきか。これは確かに、新たなる時代の夜明けなのだろう。我々の物語はまだ終わってはいない。むしろ、これは始まりに過ぎないのだ。ノースガードには休息と治療が必要だ。そして我々はその傷を癒やすためにここにいる。 </5> <6> であればこそ、かつて未開にして敵意溢れる地と我々が呼んだこの大陸を...これからはこう呼ぼう... </6> <7> 故郷、と。 </7>

Maelstrom.name: Dying World (Maelstrom)
Maelstrom.objectives: <0 id="m0"> Colonize the Portal to Yggdrazil and keep controle during one year </0> <1 id="b0"> Kill at least 20 Valkyries </1> <2 id="b1"> Reach 10 happiness and keep that during one year </2> <3 id="b2"> Reach Portal before year 4 </3>
Maelstrom.cinematic: <0> At last we were reaching our goal. But as we marched forward, a great indescribable sound shook earth and sky alike. It still echoes through my mind. </0> <1> This was, of course, Gjallarhorn's wail, and the beginning of Ragnarök. It had opened the portal to Bifrost, and in so doing had upset the world itself. </1> <2> Hurrying across a Northgard that was more wretched than ever, we made our way to the portal to thwart Hvedrung's baleful plans. </2>

Debug.name: Debug
Debug.objectives: <0 id="m0"> Test objectif 1 </0> <1 id="m1"> Test objectif 2 : ::value:: </1>

BannerStag.name: ブランド
BannerStag.desc: 高い誇りと高潔さを心に秘めた鹿のクランの旗手は、名誉と共に生きて戦う忠実な男だ。彼にとって、自らが率いる民の幸せ以上に大事なことはない。彼は父親がそうであったように貴方への信心にあつく、貴方の復讐とノースガードの覇者となる手助けをする意思を見せている。

BannerGoat.name: ハルバード
BannerGoat.desc:
山羊クランの老旗手は思慮深く温かい心を持った男で、彼が率いる民が生き延びることに心を砕いている。彼は無意味なる暴力を嫌ってはいるが、売られた戦いには全力をもって反撃する。
彼とヘイズルーンのクランは、彼らを餓狼から救った後、貴方への忠誠を誓った。

BannerWolf.name: イージル
BannerWolf.desc: 狼のクランの若き旗手は冷酷で熱しやすい狂戦士である、騒乱を楽しむために戦いの場にいる。ブランドは自らの大義に彼を引き込むのに少々苦心した。復讐の旅、そして栄光の戦いへの約束は、彼の興奮を誘うには十分だった。

BannerRaven.name: リヴ
BannerRaven.desc: 野心的で実利主義、鴉クランの狡猾な旗手は、状況のあらゆる要素の掌握を好み、時間やクラウンを無駄に消費することを嫌う。戦局が変わると見るや、彼女は上司であるヘイゲンを躊躇なく殺し、あなたへの忠誠を示してみせた。

BannerBoar.name: スヴァーン
BannerBoar.desc: 猪のクラン反逆者の無口なる精神的指導者は、自然に寄り添った簡素な人生を送り、古き道に従う賢者にして戦士。ヴェンドルングに対する彼の蜂起は、貴方が介入したときにはすでに粉砕の一歩手前であった。共通の仇敵を持つ貴方を、彼は身を賭して手助けしようとしてくれている。

BannerBear.name: ボルギルデ
BannerBear.desc: 勇敢にして粗野な熊のクランの旗手にして、何者にも屈せず、弱き心を持つものには慈悲を見せない、たくましい女性。貴方が王者の角笛を失ったことを理由に、彼女は貴方を正当なる王として認めることを拒否して勝負を持ちかけたが、貴方はこの勝負に勝利した。彼女は渋々、貴方への忠誠を誓う以外の選択肢を与えられなかった。
